titleStmt.title: Uppsala University Library, Gr. 14
titleStmt.sponsor: Greek manuscripts in Sweden – a digitization and cataloguing project

publicationStmt.publisher: manuscripta.se: A Digital Catalogue of Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts in Sweden

supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in ink in the upper right margin of recto pages: 1–216. An earlier foliation in Greek numerals, also in the upper right margin of recto pages: αʹ–σιεʹ. The two foliations differ slightly from each other from and onwards, but both were executed after the far-reaching disarray and loss of the leaves had taken place.

p.note: Blank endleaves, except for a for a shelfmark label on . The first endleaf is partly pasted down (or has been lifted to expose the cover inside).
Blank endleaves, except for a few paragraph numbers that go together with the text on the opposite page, . The second endleaf is partly pasted down.

binding.p: Greek-style binding, bound in wooden boards cut flush with the textblock. The boards have grooves at all edges. Unsupported sewing on five sewing stations. Reddish-brown goatskin cover, blind-tooled with frames and vegetal borders. Holes after two straps and pins at foredge. Another single hole in the left cover. Compound endbands with secondary sewing in green, red and white silk. A movable string marker of linen thread attached to the headband. Modern endleaves.
binding.condition: Rebound. In this process, the bookblock was restored extensively. Each leaf was given a new guard and sometimes also new margins, but many leaves had apparently gone missing prior to that radical rescue operation. Most often it is the outer double-leaf in the quire that has been lost.

history.origin: Written in the 13th or early 14th c.. Place of origin unknown.
history.provenance: Acquired by Jacob Jonas Björnståhl (), during his travels through Europe in the years , most likely when he was visiting Thessaly in .
history.acquisition: Came as a donation to Uppsala University Library in .

msItem.title: Prolegomena in Aristidem
msItem.note: Where manuscript readings differ from Dindorf’s and Lenz’ editions, they seem to relate most closely to manuscripts A, M, p, and r in Lenz’ apparatus (Vat. 1899; Marc. 423; Vat. Pal. 90; Vat. 1298).

msItem.title: Scholia in Aelium Aristidem (scholia vetera)
msItem.rubric: σχόλιον εἰς τὴν ἀρχὴν τοῦ παναθηναϊκοῦ λόγου
msItem.explicit: ἐκ δὲ τοῦ ἐστὶ τὸ ἔτι αὐτὸν κρατεῖν

msItem.title: Panathenaica
msItem.note: One leaf has gone missing after , creating a lacuna equalling ed. Lenz 16, 10 – 18, 5 (ἔσχηκεν εἰς αὐτά – ὀνομάζουσι τοὺς δευτέρους ἐλθόντας). Likewise, there is a leaf missing after (ed. Lenz 43, 6 – 45, 16; εἶναι τὸν μέγιστον ὅρον – ἔχειν ὥσπερ χρήμασιν). The manuscript text breaks off at ed. Lenz 57, 16: after that point, around four quaternions or sixty percent of the original text seem to have been lost.

collation.p: Due to the present state of the volume, with many lost leaves and far-reaching restoration of the paper, the suggested quire structure can only be tentative. Of the original eight quaternions – unless more texts followed upon the Panathenaica – the last four are now lost altogether. The remaining quires should be construed as follows (x stands for one lost leaf): Q1: fol. 1–8, Q2: x + 9–15, Q3: fol. 16–21 + x + 22, Q4: fol. 23–27 + xxx.
collation.signatures: No original quire signatures are preserved. The numbering of every tenth leaf in the lower margin is a later addition.

decoDesc.p: Headpiece in brown ink on and a couple of larger initials on – unskillfully executed later additions.

msItem.title: Palinodia de Smyrna
msItem.rubric: Ἐπιστολὴ Σμύρνης καὶ πρὸς τὸν αὐτοκράτορα· Ἀριστείδου Παλινῳδία ἐπὶ Σμύρνῃ καὶ τῷ ταύτης ἀνοικισμῷ
msItem.note: Although split up, these three leaves actually contain the complete text. In addition to the Smyrnaea Politica, which follows directly below, yet another work by Aristides on Smyrna (De Smyrna epistula ad imperatores) is found on ; those two texts would have preceded the Palinodia before the leaves in the codex were disarranged.

msItem.title: Smyrnaea Politica
msItem.note: Where the texts breaks off, the manuscript probably lacks two leaves (those would have fitted the rest of this speech and the first few lines of Cyzicena Panegyrica.

msItem.title: Cyzicena Panegyrica
msItem.note: The manuscript lacks some eight to ten lines at the beginning of the speech.

msItem.explicit: ὅπερ εἰς τὸν Ἀριστείδον τύπον φέρει

msItem.quote: Ὁ γενεθλιακὸς οὗτος ὑπεβλήθη πρὸ μιᾶς τοῦ ἀναγνωσθῆναι ἐν τῇ καθέδρᾳ τῇ ἐπὶ γάμῳ· αὐτοῦ ὄντος ἔτων κθʹ· λύσις δὲ ἀνήδονος εἰ καὶ πάνυ δοχεῖ.

msItem.title: Pro pace Atheniensibus concedenda
msItem.note: The text opens with a scholion: Πλεῖστα ἐν ὀλίγοις ἔχει ὁ λόγος καὶ τὰ πάθη λανθάνοντα καὶ πρέποντα ἀνδρὶ Σπαρτιάτῃ καὶ ὡς ἂν μάλιστ’ ἤνυσεν. Due to the loss of leaves, only the first twelve lines of this text are preserved.

msItem.title: De societate ad Thebaios 1
msItem.note: The beginning of this text is missing, the amount of text probably equalling one leaf.

msItem.title: Dionysus
msItem.note: Due to the loss of leaves, only the first twelve lines of this text are preserved.

msItem.title: Ad Aesculapii puteum
msItem.note: Only the last few lines of this text are preserved.

msItem.title: Ad Capitonem
msItem.note: The loss of text at the end equals about two and a half manuscript pages.

msItem.title: Pro Quattuor viris: Hypothesis 2
msItem.explicit: ἀνέλῃ τῶν δοκούντων ἐγκλημάτων τὴν διαβολήν
msItem.note: Only the second half of the hypothesis is preserved.

msItem.title: Pro Quattuor viris
msItem.note: The main text is preceded by scholia on . Scholia are also inserted at other places, sometimes in-between paragraphs, sometimes in a separate column on the page or else in the margins along with the main text. Lacunae: one leaf is missing after with resulting textual loss; ditto at ; after several leaves have been lost; one leaf is missing after with resulting textual loss. On there is another rubric, even though this is just part of the main text: Ἀριστείδου κοινὴ ἀπολογία Θεμιστοκλῆς. One scholion is not included in Dindorf’s edition: ἀφιλόσοφον τὸ ἐνθύμημα· μελέτη γὰρ θανάτου τοῖς φιλοσόφοις ὁ βίος, τὴν ἀπὸ τοῦ σώματος καὶ τῶν σωματικῶν ἐλευθερίαν ποθοῦσι καὶ τῆς καθαρᾶς ζωῆς ἐκτόπως ἐρῶσι (in the margin of ).

collation.p: Due to the present state of the volume, with many lost leaves and far-reaching restoration of the paper, it is difficult to confirm the original quire structure.
collation.signatures:
Many of the original quire signatures are trimmed out, and in several cases the outer leaves of the quires have been lost. Thus, only a couple original signatures remain in the lower right margin of the last verso. ϛʹ
ιαʹ

decoDesc.p:
Rubricated titles and some red initials, mostly plain. Only a couple of flourished initials; see e.g.
.

msItem.title: Contra incriminantes quod non declamaret
msItem.rubric: Πρὸς τοὺς αἰτιωμένους ὅτι μὴ μελετῴη

msItem.title: In proditores mysteriorum
msItem.finalRubric: Ἀριστείδου κατὰ τῶν ἐξορχουμένων κοινῶς Ἀσίας ἐν Σμύρνη ἐθαυμάσθη δὲ ὑπεράπαντας
msItem.note: In the margin of a scholion on three kinds of ἀμαθία, not found in Dindorf’s edition; on another one to the lemma μάσθλης.

collation.p: One leaf has become misplaced; the correct order of the leaves should be: 124, 126–131, 125, 132–136. There are no traces left of the original quire structure.

decoDesc.p: Titles partly in red ink, partly in black. Simple ornaments in red or black accompanying rubrics and some initials (see e.g. ).

msItem.title: Calumniae non temere credendum
msItem.note: With scholia.

msItem.title: Cataplus
msItem.rubric: Λουκιανοῦ Κατάπλους ἢ Τύραννος· Τὰ πρόσωπα εἰσὶ Χάρων καὶ Κλωθώ
msItem.note: The manuscript text lacks paragraphs 25–28, approximately what would have been accomodated on one leaf.

msItem.title: Gallus
msItem.note: The manuscript lacks some half a page, or one and a half paragraph, at the beginning of the text, and most of the last three paragraphs due to missing leaves. What is present are paragraphs 2, line 12 – 31, line 3.

msItem.title: Prometheus
msItem.note: Around two thirds of the text are missing due to loss of leaves; the manuscript picks up at the last line of paragraph 15.

msItem.title: Icaromenippus
msItem.rubric: Ἰκαρομένιππος ἢ Ὑπερνέφελος. Τὰ πρόσωπα Μένιππος καὶ Ἑταῖρος.
msItem.note: Incomplete due to the loss of leaves; paragraphs 1–30 remain.

note.p: The manuscript text picks up in the middle of paragraph 14.

On there is a scribal note in monocondylic style, which reveals that the volume at some stage also incorporated four works by Anicius Manlius Severinus Boethius. Those are not preserved in the manuscript anymore: Ἀριστείδης τε καὶ Λουκιανὸς ἅμα μεστὴν ἀποτελοῦσι τὴν βίβλον ταύτην. πρὸς δὲ τούτοις ἔνεστι καὶ τοῦ σοφοῦ Βοετίου δράματα δ.

msItem.title: An anonymous letter
msItem.incipit: Τὴν σὴν ἐπιστολὴν ἀνεγνωκὼς ἐπὶ πᾶσι τεθαύμακα
msItem.explicit: πρὸς τὸν πάντα ἄριστον ἐμοὶ ἢ ἰσχύσω τε ἠνιᾶσαι μοι ἐμαυτῷ

msItem.title: Adversus indoctum et libros multos ementem
msItem.incipit: καὶ τοῦτο. κατὰ ταὐτὰ δὴ καὶ ὁ κυβερνᾶν
msItem.note: The manuscript text picks up in the middle of paragraph 5.

msItem.title: Bacchus
msItem.explicit: οἱ ἄνδρες δὲ τῆς Πανικῆς, τῆς δὲ τοῦ
msItem.note: The text breaks off at the last line of paragraph 6 (paragraphs 7–8 missing).

msItem.title: Somnium sive vita Luciani
msItem.rubric: Περὶ τοῦ ἐνυπνίου ἤτοι βίος Λουκιανοῦ

msItem.title: Eleusinia
msItem.incipit: πολέμιοι· ὦ πάλαι τε καὶ νῦν
msItem.finalRubric: Ἐλευσίνιος ἐγράφη ὅσον ἐν ὥρᾳ ἐν Σμύρνῃ μηνὶ ιβʹ ἐπὶ ἡγεμόνος Μακρίνου ἔτων ὄντι ΝΓʹ καὶ μηνῶν ἕξ· ἐλέχθη δὲ ἐν τῷ βουλευτηρίῳ
msItem.note: Only a few lines from the end of this speech remain.

msItem.title: De Smyrna epistula ad imperatores
msItem.rubric: Ἀριστείδου ἐπιστολὴ περὶ Σμύρνης καὶ πρὸς τοὺς βασιλεῖς τῶν Ῥωμαίων
msItem.note: On a scribal note in the lower margin: τὰ ἔμπροσθεν οὐκ οἶδα πῶς θέτω, ἐνηλλαγμένα ἐτύγχανον. Note also that another text on Smyrna begins at the bottom of : that text is presently split up on three separate leaves in the volume and has been described above in connection with .

collation.p: Due to severe restauration with trimmed leaves and new glued-on guards, it is not possible to accomplish a collation. Fol. 125 should have come after fol. 131, and fol. 191 belongs before fol. 145. Furthermore, the overall order of the texts has probably undergone changes at rebinding, since the writer’s note on may be an indication that this leaf was once the last leaf of the book, or at least of the Aristotle and Lucian collection of texts.
collation.signatures:
Only two original quire signatures left, in the lower right margin of the last verso
αʹ
ϛʹ

decoDesc.p: Red titles, plain red initials, a modest headpiece on ; marginalia sometimes in red.

msItem.title: Dialogi deorum, N:o 15–17. 21. 25. 24. 22–23. 20. 19. 18.
msItem.note: The end of the last dialogue, n:o 18, is lacking.

msItem.title: Dearum judicium
msItem.note: On there are several brief lacunae in the manuscript text, a couple of words missing, as though the writing area of the protograph might have been partly damaged or unreadable here.

msItem.title: Scholia in Lucianum; 77, prol.
msItem.quote: Ἐν τούτοις τοῖς διαλόγοις διαπαίξειν βούλεται τὰ παρὰ τῶν ἀθέων Ἑλλήνων περὶ τοῦ Ἅιδου λεγόμενα καὶ διὰ τοῦτο νεκροὺς εἰσάγει ἔνθεν καὶ νεκρικοὺς τοὺς διαλόγους ὠνόμασεν.
msItem.note: The scholion belongs with the following text, which begins on . Note that the leaf in-between these passages, , is in the wrong place and should have preceded .

note.p: Note that the Greek numbering is internal and does not take into account that Dialogue 6 is omitted (i.e., Λόγοι ιʹ, ιαʹ, ιδʹ equal Dialogues 11, 12, and 15).

msItem.title: Demonax
msItem.note: The manuscript text lacks the last few words.

collation.p: Due to restauration with trimmed leaves and new glued-on guards, it is not possible to accomplish a collation of the original quires.

decoDesc.p: Titles, initials, and some marginalia in red ink.

revisionDesc.change: Changing status from draft to published
